gnome-system-monitor-45.0.2 fails to compile with LTO enabled
Fix LTO compilation error
gnome-system-monitor-45.0.2 fails to compile with LTO enabled

note.body:
Issue occurs because application.h uses HAVE_WNCK declarative, and #include <config.h> is missing, where it's defined. This patch fixes it:

```
diff --git a/src/application.h b/src/application.h
index b5bacb2f..773927de 100644
--- a/src/application.h
+++ b/src/application.h
@@ -2,6 +2,7 @@
 #ifndef _GSM_APPLICATION_H_
 #define _GSM_APPLICATION_H_
 
+#include <config.h>
 #include <gtkmm.h>
 #include <glibtop/cpu.h>
 #include <handy.h>
```

target_title: gnome-system-monitor-45.0.2 fails to compile with LTO enabled

note.body:
Thanks for your quick reply.

It is indeed the system-monitor (Version 4) of the [gnome-shell-extensions](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-shell-extensions) project. The GNOME Version ist 47 and the screenshot was taken from a Ubuntu 24.10.

Can you move this issue to gnome-shell-extensions project if feasible? Thanks.

note.body: Hi, where is that screenshot from? How to make gnome-system-monitor display items in the desktop top bar? Please see https://handbook.gnome.org/issues.html and also add exact version information, package format (native deb/rpm, or Flatpak/Snap/etc), distribution information. Thanks!

[graph] Fix CPU graph's initial computations

note.body: @luizgfc no worries, we all make mistakes. I initially tried to understand and work around the problem with your patch, but due to time constraints and other issues I had I could not, so the easy and quick solution was to revert the patch. Thanks for getting back with a new and updated patch, and yes, staying around until the patch gets released is a nice thing to do, but any contribution is welcome, even without that, the worst thing which could happen is that the patch gets reverted after identifying that it is the obvious culprit for a regression.

Draft: proctable: Port to GtkColumnView

note.body:
Progress here is a bit stalled. Apparently in the dependencies view child processes are inserted but none are visible. I have checked this by converting the GListModel children of `proctable-data` to a property and checking it in the GTK inspector.

I will try to revisit the code soon, but if anyone has any idea what might be wrong it would be very helpful.

target_title: Draft: proctable: Port to GtkColumnView

note.body:
Indeed, it solves #245.

No, it does not solve #322. It improves a little by having increased the size of the icons, but they will look the same as the icons in the disk list.

target_title: Draft: proctable: Port to GtkColumnView

note.body: This seems to solve #245 too; does it also address #322 ?

target_title: Processes and disks icons are blurry in hidpi
Potential memory leak due to excessive mmap() calls

note.body: The proposed workaround from https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk/-/issues/7045 indeed solves the issue for me in the sense that with the gl renderer, it now runs for several hours already without a noticeable memory usage increase. So that one indeed seems to be the problem we observe here.

target_title: Potential memory leak due to excessive mmap() calls

note.body: Is this issue related to the GTK issue https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk/-/issues/7013 , which was resolved in GTK 4.16.2? (See also: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gtk/-/issues/7045 .)
